page.title: 02WATER-BAILIFF ON THE WYE
page.content: Ralph Hutton is a{water-bailiff}and looks after a stretch of the{River {Wye. His job}is to prevent poaching, keep an eye on pollution,check licences, and to help people on the river. He is employed by the{Welsh {Water Authority}based in{Hereford.} {Fishing rights}on this stretch of water are owned by{Mr Ian Jones}and{ {Heritage Investments Ltd.}Fishermen must have the owner's permission and a licence.{Licences}can be obtained from the water-bailiff or Keeling's Fishing Tackle Shop in{Monmouth.}Annual rates for licences are:{salmon,}Â£23.80;{ {trout,}Â£6-80;{coarse fishing,}Â£4.00; (reductions for O.A.P's).The{salmon {season}is 26th.Jan.-17th.Oct.,{trout 3rd.Mar.-30th.Sept.,and the{close {season}for{coarse fishing}14th. Mar.- 16th.June. { }
